title: Towel, early 17th century
medium:
Medium: linen, silk
Technique: embroidered on plain weave using double running stitches for linear details; background area has horizontal and vertical wrapping stitches pulled tight to deflect groups of warps and wefts; weft loops in a countered two unit
description: Towel with an embroidered end and side borders in red. The embroidery fills the background of the pattern in a pattern of a curving vine. Decorative silk fringe sewn to four sides in red and white block pattern.

tombstone.epitaph:
Towel, early 17th century.Medium: linen, silk
Technique: embroidered on plain weave using double running stitches for linear details; background area has horizontal and vertical wrapping stitches pulled tight to deflect groups of warps and wefts; weft loops in a countered two unit. 1978-128-2.
